actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna({'Age': X_train['Age'].mean(), 'Embarked': X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0]}, inplace=True)
test_df.fillna({'Age': test_df['Age'].mean(), 'Embarked': test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0]}, inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_val, X_test, y_val, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predict on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df[features])
})
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna({'Age': X_train['Age'].mean(), 'Embarked': X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0]}, inplace=True)
test_df.fillna({'Age': test_df['Age'].mean(), 'Embarked': test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0]}, inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Ensure both DataFrames have the same columns
common_features = list(set(X_train.columns) & set(test_df.columns))
X_train = X_train[common_features]
test_df = test_df[common_features]

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_val, X_test, y_val, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predict on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df)
})
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna({'Age': X_train['Age'].mean(), 'Embarked': X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0]}, inplace=True)
test_df.fillna({'Age': test_df['Age'].mean(), 'Embarked': test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0]}, inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Ensure both DataFrames have the same columns
common_features = list(set(X_train.columns) & set(test_df.columns))
X_train = X_train[common_features]
test_df = test_df[common_features]

# Add PassengerId back to test_df
test_df['PassengerId'] = test_df.reset_index().index + 892

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_val, X_test, y_val, y_test = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_val)

# Evaluate model
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predict on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df.drop(columns='PassengerId'))
})
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
